Generation V.Black: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.
Generation V.White: Since their two heads do not get along and compete with each other for food, they always eat too much.
Generation V.Black 2: The two heads do not get along. Whichever head eats more than the other gets to be the leader.
Generation V.White 2: The two heads do not get along. Whichever head eats more than the other gets to be the leader.

Generation VI.X: The two heads do not get along. Whichever head eats more than the other gets to be the leader.
Generation VI.Y: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: The two heads do not get along. Whichever head eats more than the other gets to be the leader.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.

Generation VIII.Sword: While hunting for prey, Zweilous wanders its territory, its two heads often bickering over which way to go.
Generation VIII.Shield: Their two heads will fight each other over a single piece of food. Zweilous are covered in scars even without battling others.

Generation IX.Scarlet: The two heads do not get along at all. If you don’t give each head the same amount of attention, they’ll begin fighting out of jealousy.
Generation IX.Violet: The two heads have different likes and dislikes. Because the heads fight with each other, Zweilous gets stronger without needing to rely on others.

Generation VIII.Sword: Lake of Outrage Dusty Bowl , Giant's Mirror , Bridge Field ( Max Raid Battle )

Generation IX.Scarlet: North Province: Area Two , Glaseado Mountain Area Zero Tera Raid Battles ( 4★ )
Generation IX.Violet: Union Circle Tera Raid Battle Search ( 4★ )
